title: Rashi on II Samuel
text: And behold, a man came from the camp- There is [an opinion found] in Pesikta that this is Doeg, but it does not dwell on my heart (I disagree).
And his second was Kilav- And in a different place (Chronicles II, 3:1), it calls him Daniel, and so why was he called Kilav [here]? Rav Yitzchak said,

"It was on account of the scoffers of the generation, who said, 'Avigayil (Kilav's mom) was pregnant from Naval (her previous husband),' and so [G-d] changed his appearance and he resembled his father (David)." And our Rabbis said, "Because he embarassed Mephiboshet in law study (Berakhot 4a)"
